residuals¶

Documentation for functions in the utils.residuals module:

utils.residuals.makeresids(fracts1, fracts2)[source]¶

Makes two numpy arrays containing residuals and their errors from the given fraction arrays.

Parameters:

  • fracts1 (numpy.array(float)) – 9 column 2D numpy array containing arbitrary values in the first column, and in the following columns respectively the fractions and errors (from file 1): ppg, dppg, mmg, dmmg, eeg, deeg, ppp, dppp.

  • fracts2 (numpy.array[float]) – 9 column 2D numpy array containing arbitrary values in the first column, and in the following columns respectively the fractions and errors (from file 2): ppg, dppg, mmg, dmmg, eeg, deeg, ppp, dppp.

Returns:

Two element tuple containing respectively a 4 column 2D numpy array of the residuals (column order: ppg, mmg, eeg, ppp) and a 4 column 2D numpy array of the the residual’s errors in same column order.

Return type:

tuple(numpy.array(float))

utils.residuals.fitconst(resids, dresids)[source]¶

Fits the residuals with a constant and returns the best fit constant, along with the chi square of the fit.

Parameters:

  • resids (numpy.array(float)) – 4 column 2D numpy array containing in its columns respectively the residuals for: ppg, mmg, eeg, ppp.

  • dresids (numpy.array(float)) – 4 column 2D numpy array containing in its columns respectively the errors of the residuals for: ppg, mmg, eeg, ppp.

Returns:

Three element tuple containing respectively the best fit constant, its error and the chi square of the fit.

Return type:

tuple(float)
